metadata.feature_description: Implements automatic retry logic for failed Google Analytics API operations with exponential backoff

observations: Feature is documented as 'Backend service (no direct UI)' - confirmed through code review and UI exploration
Code review of GoogleAnalyticsRemoteRetryManager.cs confirms retry mechanism is implemented using Polly library
Retry configuration: 3 retries (simple retry, NOT exponential backoff as described in feature description - code shows .Retry(3, ...) not .WaitAndRetry())
Retryable HTTP status codes configured in RetryPolicyHelper.cs: RequestTimeout (408), InternalServerError (500), BadGateway (502), ServiceUnavailable (503), GatewayTimeout (504), Unauthorized (401)
Special handling for HTTP 401 Unauthorized: Token cache is cleared via TokenServiceImpl.ClearCache() before retry attempt to allow fresh token acquisition
Retry activity is logged via Logger.Info and Logger.Warn - only observable through server logs, not UI
Google Analytics 4 connector is configured in the system (Measurement ID: G-ABC123XYZ99) but there is no UI mechanism to trigger API failures or observe retry behavior
The GoogleAnalyticsRemoteRetryManager wraps GoogleAnalyticsRemoteManager as a decorator pattern - retry logic is transparent to calling code
Unit tests exist in RetryPolicyHelperTest.cs but these are code-level tests, not UI tests

NO UI TEST SCENARIOS CREATED: This feature operates entirely at the backend service layer with no UI-observable effects. All suggested test scenarios (HTTP 401/503 retry, max attempts, backoff timing, token cache clearing, successful retry) require either mocking HTTP responses or monitoring server logs - neither of which is possible through UI testing
